revised_title: Advanced Techniques for Counting and Analyzing Alpha-Particles
tldr: The authors developed a new method for accurately counting alpha-particles emitted from radioactive sources. They used a Greinacher-type counter and ionization chambers to analyze the complexity of alpha-rays from radium, thorium, and actinium. This method allowed them to detect the presence of short-range alpha-particles in the dual disintegration of radium and revealed that actinium's alpha-rays are more complex than previously thought.
